title: 1.1 Ask Why
identification: Consult key stakeholders

title: 1.1 Ask Why
identification: Understand pains and wants

title: 1.1 Ask Why
identification: Define goals

title: 1.2 Get a Masterbuilder
identification: Define the type of person you need
definition: Confirm you have access to a master builder ready for the next stage
delivery: Confirm you have access to a master builder ready for the next stage

title: 1.2 Get a Masterbuilder
identification: Find a leader

title: 1.2 Get a Masterbuilder
identification: Get access to additional support (if needed)

title: 1.3 Get Your People on the Bus
identification: Get a team that has worked with your masterbuilder (if possible)

title: 1.3 Get Your People on the Bus
identification: Identify early champions (if there is business change)

title: 1.3 Get Your People on the Bus
identification: Run team development workshops

title: 1.4 Make Friends and Keep them Friendly
identification: Create a plan to engage with other stakeholders

title: 1.4 Make Friends and Keep them Friendly
identification: Engage stakeholders, customers, and users
definition: Empower stakeholders, users, customers to support decision making
delivery: Empower stakeholders, users, customers to support decision making

title: 1.4 Make Friends and Keep them Friendly
identification: Develop a mechanism to foster transparency and involve stakeholders in key decisions

title: 2.1 Recognise that your project is not unique
identification: Identify and learn lessons from three people or projects that have achieved similar outcomes
definition: Re-engage with past projects to learn new lessons about the next stage

title: 2.1 Recognise that your project is not unique
identification: Find out how long their projects took, what they cost, and whether the expected value was delivered

title: 2.1 Recognise that your project is not unique
identification: Apply these insights to your plan

title: 2.2 Look for Tried & Tested Options
identification: Identify three delivery methods using tried and tested techniques

title: 2.2 Look for Tried & Tested Options
identification: Validate your best option through prototyping and customer or user feedback

title: 2.2 Look for Tried & Tested Options
identification:
Complete a pros and cons list for each option. Rate against:
- Use of tried and tested methods
- Likelihood of delivering goals
- Modularity and scalability
- Ease of building a minimum or maximum viable product
Include metrics where possible

title: 3.1 Think Big, Start Small
identification: Break your preferred solution into small, modular parts
definition: Re-engage with past projects to learn new lessons about the next stage
delivery: Scale up and go big. Roll out sections / modular solution to other areas

title: 3.1 Think Big, Start Small
identification: Ask the question: what is my Lego?
definition: Validate that the solution will achieve the goals.

title: 3.1 Think Big, Start Small
identification: Ensure people and plans are in place to develop the solution in Phase 2

title: 3.2 Learn by Experimenting
identification: Create a plan to develop an MVP or MXVP in Stage 2
definition: Develop module as a minimum viable product, if possible. Otherwise, develop a maximum virtual product.
delivery: Continue regular learning and reflection sessions (at least monthly)

title: 3.2 Learn by Experimenting
identification: Start regular reflection sessions: weekly, fortnightly, or monthly
definition: Continue regular learning and reflection sessions (at least monthly)

title: 3.3 Keep on top of risks
identification: List your top five risks now
definition: Continuously identify and mittigate risks (review at least monthly)
delivery: Continuously identify and mitigate risks (review at least monthly)

title: 3.3 Keep on top of risks
identification: Create a mitigation plan for each one

title: 3.3 Keep on top of risks
identification: Review and update your risk plan monthly (or more often)

title: 4.1 Adjust for optimism
identification: Compare how long similar projects took in Stage 2 and 3 versus their original estimates
definition: Look to previous projects to identify level of optimism for Stage 3, apply this contingency % to your estimate for time / cost / resources required for stage 3
delivery: Build optimism allowances into all forecasts.

title: 4.1 Adjust for optimism
identification: Adjust your forecast based on this optimism allowance and include contingency

title: 4.2 Measure What Matters, Be Ready to Step Away
identification: Identify the success measures for your solution in Stage 2
definition: Identify the measurable success measures for your solution in Stage 3
delivery: Confirm the built solution meets your goals. Measure this with metrics.

title: 4.2 Measure What Matters, Be Ready to Step Away
identification: Confirm the business case do the benefits outweigh the costs?
definition: Confirm the business case do the benefits outweigh the costs?

title: 4.2 Measure What Matters, Be Ready to Step Away
definition: Confirm you've used data to validate your chosen option and plan, including optimism bias

title: 4.3 Be Ready to Adapt
identification: Set up regular meetings with key people to adapt to a changing world
definition: Adapt the requirements / plan / scope based as new information comes to light.
delivery: Adapt the requirements / plan / scope based as new information comes to light.
